definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: The toy can serve as "a  communication tool" for the young and old, she said.
sentences.chinese: 她说，该玩具可谓老少咸宜的“沟通工具”。

sentences.english: Eight spots suitable for all ages, the most family friendly.
sentences.chinese: 八大景点老少咸宜，最适合全家出游。

sentences.english: Kite-flying is one of the most popular pastimes among Chinese of all ages. Picture taken April 26, 2006.
sentences.chinese: 放风筝是中国最老少咸宜的消遣活动之一。

sentences.english: Today, these figures are collector's items that are adored by children and adults alike.
sentences.chinese: 如今，这些老少咸宜的塑像已成为了收藏家的收藏品。

sentences.english: Pumpkin flower is the ideal health food for both young and old.
sentences.chinese: 南瓜花是老少咸宜的理想保健食品。

sentences.english: Curry Fish Slices Rice tastes good for all.
sentences.chinese: 咖哩鱼片饭的味道是老少咸宜的。

definition: suitable for both the young and the old
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
men, women, young and old/all kinds of people/people of all ages
to make learning fun/to combine education and entertainment
to whet the appetite/appetizing/to amuse oneself at sb's expense/to tease
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
